definitions.definition: The result of copying; an identical duplicate of an original.
definitions.example: Please bring me the copies of those reports.

definitions.definition: An imitation, sometimes of inferior quality.
definitions.example: That handbag is a copy. You can tell because the buckle is different.

definitions.definition: The text that is to be typeset.
A gender-neutral abbreviation for copy boy.
The output of copywriters, who are employed to write material which encourages consumers to buy goods or services.

definitions.example: Submit all copy to the appropriate editor.
Tim got in trouble for forgetting his maths copy.

definitions.definition: A printed edition of a book or magazine.
definitions.example: Have you seen the latest copy of "Newsweek" yet?

definitions.definition: Writing paper of a particular size, called also bastard.
That which is to be imitated, transcribed, or reproduced; a pattern, model, or example.
definitions.example: His virtues are an excellent copy for imitation.

definitions.definition: An abundance or plenty of anything.
(genetics) The result of gene or chromosomal duplication.
To produce an object identical to a given object.
definitions.example: Please copy these reports for me.

definitions.definition: To give or transmit a copy to (a person).
definitions.example: Make sure you copy me on that important memo.

definitions.definition: To place a copy of an object in memory for later use.
definitions.example: First copy the files, and then paste them in another directory.
